# mutableCopy()

**Instance Method**

Creates a mutable copy of an existing graphics path.

## Declaration

```swift
func mutableCopy() -> CGMutablePath?
```

## Return Value

A new, mutable, copy of the specified path. You are responsible for releasing this object.

## Discussion

You can modify a mutable graphics path by calling the various path geometry functions, such as [doc://com.apple.coregraphics/documentation/CoreGraphics/CGPathAddArc], [doc://com.apple.coregraphics/documentation/CoreGraphics/CGPathAddLineToPoint], and [doc://com.apple.coregraphics/documentation/CoreGraphics/CGPathMoveToPoint].

## Copying a Graphics Path

- **mutableCopy(using:)**: Creates a mutable copy of a graphics path transformed by a transformation matrix.

items.description: Creates a mutable copy of a graphics path transformed by a transformation matrix.
